channel.title: Modern Theory of Complex Systems & Applications
channel.description: A student-led chalkboard seminar series at Weizmann Institute exploring foundational theoretical methods in complex systems research

item.title: Active Brownian Motion: From Microscopic Models to Collective Behavior
item.description: We begin our active matter series by exploring the foundational models of active Brownian particles. Starting from the basic stochastic differential equation for self-propelled particles, we will derive the key statistical properties including persistence length, effective diffusion, and velocity correlations.

item.title: The Vicsek Model: Alignment Interactions and Phase Transitions in Flocking
item.description: The Vicsek model represents a paradigmatic example of emergent collective motion arising from local alignment rules. We will develop the model from its discrete formulation, examining the interplay between alignment interactions, noise, and density effects.

item.title: Toner-Tu Theory: Hydrodynamic Description of Flocking Systems
item.description: We develop the continuum field theory for flocking systems following the seminal work of Toner and Tu. Starting from symmetry considerations and conservation laws, we will construct the hydrodynamic equations for density and velocity fields in active systems.
